page.title: 01PONTSTICILL AND VAYNOR AREA
page.content: {The villages of Pontsticill and Vaynor lie to the north of Merthyr Tydfil in South Wales.The villages are situated on the western side of the valley of the Taf Fechan river itself dammed a century ago to provide water for the townspeople to the south. The land above the valley is an old plateau area which rises northwards to the foot of the Brecon Beacons a few miles away.The plateau is mostly covered by moorland which provides rough grazing for sheep, although many of the valley slopes are planted with coniferous trees.The reservoir nowadays attracts tourists to the area with its facilities for fishing and sailing.The Brecon Mountain Railway operates steam trains in the summer months from Pontsticill. The area lies almost entirely within the Brecon Beacons National Park.
